title: Vaculin
author: Vaculin
content: Just trying to get the communities opinion based on their experience about the topic. Personally, a a bettor, I find it very stressful when watching the game you are betting especially if it will end up a losing bet. If we have the same experience, how do you cope up with that problem, after all, gambling should be fun but why we have this kind of feeling that we feel disappointed when our bet loses?

comments.author: traderethereum
comments.body: It is normal if we are disappointed by losing a match, which causes us to experience loss.If you want to avoid disappointment after placing a bet on his team, you don't need to watch the match and do something else so that your mind won't be curious about the result. Additionally, once you place a bet, make yourself forget about that bet and return to the casino when it's over.If the result is a loss, you will not be disappointed because you only placed a bet with an amount you can afford.And if you win, you can cash out the winnings and enjoy it.But usually, a gambler who places a bet on a match will watch the match too so they can find out whether their team will win or lose.So it is a normal thing that gamblers feel when they lose.

comments.author: Japinat
comments.body: I normally bet a significant amount of money based on my limit. Based on my experience, when you are watching a game you bet with, you'll be able to experience mixed emotions, and that's normal which I think that would give a thrill in sports betting. Of course, when you lose you feel sad, but it's not something that would stay for long, you still have time to bounce back and try to win. I guess if you are really serious with gambling, you need to learn how to control your emotion first. The fact Â that we are dealing with money here, it should be properly handle in order to grow it, but being weak emotionally, it might create problems along the way.

comments.body: Quote from: Vaculin on December 13, 2023, 06:18:35 AMJust trying to get the communities opinion based on their experience about the topic. But whenever you are watching the game without you staking your money you won't attached any feelings because you are neutral not losing not gaining rather watching to ease oneself.

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: Quote from: Vaculin on December 13, 2023, 06:18:35 AMJust trying to get the communities opinion based on their experience about the topic. Personally, a a bettor, I find it very stressful when watching the game you are betting especially if it will end up a losing bet. If we have the same experience, how do you cope up with that problem, after all, gambling should be fun but why we have this kind of feeling that we feel disappointed when our bet loses?It depends of how big the bet actually is. The bigger the bet, the most stressful experience you get. I don't know about any sports bettor, who would be stressed out about a 1 dollar bet.  If you bet your life savings on a single football match, the stress level would probably hit the roof.Sports betting is fun, but in a different way, in comparison to the traditional casino games. I don't know how to describe it. In traditional casino games(for example poker) you are the one, who is playing the game and making decisions. This is what creates the fun experience. While in sports betting, you have to analyze your team(or athlete), place your bet and just wait for the end result. This is a more passive experience, in comparison to the active casino gambling experience.

comments.author: retreat
comments.body: Yeah I'm not that interested in watching the games I bet on, even when it's my own favorite team. I think that when I watch it and the game doesn't go as expected, I worry that it will ruin my mood during the game. So instead of feeling disturbed, it's better for me to avoid watching the match and use that time to play slots or other activities.

comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: Quote from: Vaculin on December 13, 2023, 06:18:35 AMJust trying to get the communities opinion based on their experience about the topic. Personally, a a bettor, I find it very stressful when watching the game you are betting especially if it will end up a losing bet. If we have the same experience, how do you cope up with that problem, after all, gambling should be fun but why we have this kind of feeling that we feel disappointed when our bet loses?I feel like you are becoming extra frustrated because you bet with huge amount of money that you probably cannot afford to lose. It has been mentioned here oftentimes that we should not stake amount of money that we cannot afford to lose for bets because of the psychological trauma it comes with. We all have our mental health to protect at the end of everything and that should matter most to us.If you are gambling for fun sake, stake some few cash that you can afford to lose. In fact, to make it more fun, you can stake for higher odds with no much expectations since the amount can be ignored when things go wrongly. I suggest you should take it from that angle of staking what you can afford to lose and not some huge cash or your income. It will end up affecting you and instead of enjoying the fun that comes with it, you end up being frustrated and in worst cases, you become depressed.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Vaculin on December 13, 2023, 06:18:35 AMJust trying to get the communities opinion based on their experience about the topic. Using huge amount or the amount of money that you can not afford to lose to gamble has been the reason you will be watching the match and be panicking while losing. Gambling should not be like that.

comments.author: btc_angela
comments.body: Quote from: Vaculin on December 13, 2023, 06:18:35 AMJust trying to get the communities opinion based on their experience about the topic. Or at least what's painful is that like in sports bet, you want to bet on the other team and then you change your mind and suddenly end up losing.As to how we cope, I guess we should let it go and not think about it. Maybe you just have to take a walk or something, talk to your family member, at least do something that will get away your mind from that losses. And then after that, you will feel good and might go and bet the next day.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: I usually remain indifferent to the events I have played. For sure, a victory can made my day but you can always have a positive day when the main objective is to "have fun" while betting and not trying to "earn money".I don't think "having fun" from "gambling" are two separable factors. Practically, in one way or another they are always linked to each other.

comments.author: EluguHcman
comments.body: Such is usually cause by an inability to accept loosing ones bets probably that you don't find fun in your gambling other than basically considering the excitements in your winnings and the sadness at your losts.You are being anxious about your games but most considering moments of loosing as unbearable states of time to withstand the fact of loosing.It happens most times of repeatedly failure so you literally ain't fit anymore to accepting further losses.Quote from: Vaculin on December 13, 2023, 06:18:35 AMIf we have the same experience, how do you cope up with that problem, after all, gambling should be fun but why we have this kind of feeling that we feel disappointed when our bet loses?Oh yeah... It happens to me sometimes most especially at a wrapping (finishing) points of the game While it is not going interesting and no hope of my winning.Then I feels like leaning on someone behind to just tell me how it ended instead of having my eyes and attentions on the board. Sometimes too I would take slow back steps like I am walking away with the believe that I have lost but yet I am expecting the least seconds before the end game to make an exciting different then I could step up again with a cheers of yeah..... I made it.

comments.author: killerfrost
comments.body: OP, I can understand that feeling, especially during bets where I am under pressure from money and the desire to win. With gambling perhaps the appeal makes people blind to decisions and believe in a chance of making money.But still honestly, if you want to get out of that situation, manage your assets before playing, considering that money will definitely be lost and you have nothing to regret. I don't believe too much in life-changing opportunities based on gambling, because luck is inherently fair, if it's not good enough, don't expect much luck.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: Quote from: Vaculin on December 13, 2023, 06:18:35 AMJust trying to get the communities opinion based on their experience about the topic. It's likely to cause you an immediate behavioral change when watching the game. Although whenever I play a game I'd always go to check on the scores much frequently but I wouldn't just glue my eye to the screen or the game because it gives me some sort of discomfort and I don't like that. Although there are people who really prefer to watch their game, so they can see every detail and maybe know when to start praying just Incase their game is going the contrary direction lol.

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: Every game has its excitement, either football or UFC or racing games, and to get the full excitement package while be a gambler you only need to risk what you can afford to lose, think over head, that if the game goes out of your favour will you like losing the money? Gamblers don't always think about the aftermath, they are always so stuck in the present.If the amount you risk is very low you will comfortably enjoy the game and what happens after won't matter, but if you risk a lot of money, while the game is ongoing you will feel the panic inside and react to any situation in the game, rest will only occur after the game ends and you win.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: Quote from: Vaculin on December 13, 2023, 06:18:35 AMJust trying to get the communities opinion based on their experience about the topic. Unfortunately, there as some small mistakes by your team causing you to lose that one.Quote from: Vaculin on December 13, 2023, 06:18:35 AMIf we have the same experience, how do you cope up with that problem, after all, gambling should be fun but why we have this kind of feeling that we feel disappointed when our bet loses?Just accept the fact that you have lost your bet already and that there's nothing that you can do about it. Maybe learn a thing or two, and then look at how you analyzed the game. Maybe you might have missed something along the way and then just put this as a learning experience.

comments.body: I prefer to watch the game with bet instead of watch without a bet because I mostly bet on a game where I'm interested to watch. But if there are many games I bet and there are two or more games happen at the same time, I can only watch one game and only watch the highlight on the another games.I only feel disappointed when the team or player I bet not play like their last match, but if they have show a good fight, even I lose my bet, I can accept that.
